bank.entry:
Your startup has never implemented a formal security policy. Currently, everyone in the company has access to the datasets stored in Google BigQuery. Teams have freedom to use the service as they see fit, and they have not documented their use cases. You have been asked to secure the data warehouse. You need to discover what everyone is doing. What should you do first?
false Use Google Stackdriver Audit Logs to review data access.
false Get the identity and access management IIAM) policy of each table
false Use Stackdriver Monitoring to see the usage of BigQuery query slots.
false Use the Google Cloud Billing API to see what account the warehouse is being billed to.
Answer: C
You are designing a basket abandonment system for an ecommerce company. The system will send a message to a user based on these rules: No interaction by the user on the site for 1 hour Has added more than $30 worth of products to the basket Has not completed a transaction You use Google Cloud Dataflow to process the data and decide if a message should be sent. How should you design the pipeline?
false Use a fixed-time window with a duration of 60 minutes.
false Use a sliding time window with a duration of 60 minutes.
false Use a session window with a gap time duration of 60 minutes.
false Use a global window with a time based trigger with a delay of 60 minutes.
Answer: D
You want to use a database of information about tissue samples to classify future tissue samples as either normal or mutated. You are evaluating an unsupervised anomaly detection method for classifying the tissue samples. Which two characteristic support this method? (Choose two.)
false There are very few occurrences of mutations relative to normal samples.
false There are roughly equal occurrences of both normal and mutated samples in the database.
false You expect future mutations to have different features from the mutated samples in the database.
false You expect future mutations to have similar features to the mutated samples in the database.
false You already have labels for which samples are mutated and which are normal in the database.
Answer: BC
You want to use Google Stackdriver Logging to monitor Google BigQuery usage. You need an instant notification to be sent to your monitoring tool when new data is appended to a certain table using an insert job, but you do not want to receive notifications for other tables. What should you do?
false Make a call to the Stackdriver API to list all logs, and apply an advanced filter.
false In the Stackdriver logging admin interface, and enable a log sink export to BigQuery.
false In the Stackdriver logging admin interface, enable a log sink export to Google Cloud Pub/Sub, and subscribe to the topic from your monitoring tool.
false Using the Stackdriver API, create a project sink with advanced log filter to export to Pub/Sub, and subscribe to the topic from your monitoring tool.
Answer: B
Your company is in a highly regulated industry. One of your requirements is to ensure individual users have access only to the minimum amount of information required to do their jobs. You want to enforce this requirement with Google BigQuery. Which three approaches can you take? (Choose three.)
false Disable writes to certain tables.
false Restrict access to tables by role.
false Ensure that the data is encrypted at all times.
false Restrict BigQuery API access to approved users.
false Segregate data across multiple tables or databases.
false Use Google Stackdriver Audit Logging to determine policy violations.
Answer: BDF
Your company has hired a new data scientist who wants to perform complicated analyses across very large datasets stored in Google Cloud Storage and in a Cassandra cluster on Google Compute Engine. The scientist primarily wants to create labelled data sets for machine learning projects, along with some visualization tasks. She reports that her laptop is not powerful enough to perform her tasks and it is slowing her down. You want to help her perform her tasks. What should you do?
false Run a local version of Jupiter on the laptop.
false Grant the user access to Google Cloud Shell.
false Host a visualization tool on a VM on Google Compute Engine.
false Deploy Google Cloud Datalab to a virtual machine (VM) on Google Compute Engine.
Answer: B
You are building a model to make clothing recommendations. You know a user’s fashion preference is likely to change over time, so you build a data pipeline to stream new data back to the model as it becomes available. How should you use this data to train the model?
false Continuously retrain the model on just the new data.
false Continuously retrain the model on a combination of existing data and the new data.
false Train on the existing data while using the new data as your test set.
false Train on the new data while using the existing data as your test set.
Answer: D
Your company built a TensorFlow neutral-network model with a large number of neurons and layers. The model fits well for the training data. However, when tested against new data, it performs poorly. What method can you employ to address this?
false Threading
false Serialization
false Dropout Methods
false Dimensionality Reduction
Answer: C
Your company is running their first dynamic campaign, serving different offers by analyzing real-time data during the holiday season. The data scientists are collecting terabytes of data that rapidly grows every hour during their 30-day campaign. They are using Google Cloud Dataflow to preprocess the data and collect the feature (signals) data that is needed for the machine learning model in Google Cloud Bigtable. The team is observing suboptimal performance with reads and writes of their initial load of 10 TB of data. They want to improve this performance while minimizing cost. What should they do?
false Redefine the schema by evenly distributing reads and writes across the row space of the table.
false The performance issue should be resolved over time as the site of the BigDate cluster is increased.
false Redesign the schema to use a single row key to identify values that need to be updated frequently in the cluster.
false Redesign the schema to use row keys based on numeric IDs that increase sequentially per user viewing the offers.
Answer: A
0
Your company’s on-premises Apache Hadoop servers are approaching end-of-life, and IT has decided to migrate the cluster to Google Cloud Dataproc. A like-for- like migration of the cluster would require 50 TB of Google Persistent Disk per node. The CIO is concerned about the cost of using that much block storage. You want to minimize the storage cost of the migration. What should you do?
false Put the data into Google Cloud Storage.
false Use preemptible virtual machines (VMs) for the Cloud Dataproc cluster.
false Tune the Cloud Dataproc cluster so that there is just enough disk for all data.
false Migrate some of the cold data into Google Cloud Storage, and keep only the hot data in Persistent Disk.
Answer: B
0
false external customer provides you with a daily dump of data from their database. The data flows into Google Cloud Storage GCS as comma-separated values (CSV) files. You want to analyze this data in Google BigQuery, but the data could have rows that are formatted incorrectly or corrupted. How should you build this pipeline?
false Use federated data sources, and check data in the SQL query.
false Enable BigQuery monitoring in Google Stackdriver and create an alert.
false Import the data into BigQuery using the gcloud CLI and set max_bad_records to 0.
false Run a Google Cloud Dataflow batch pipeline to import the data into BigQuery, and push errors to another dead-letter table for analysis.
Answer: D
1
You create an important report for your large team in Google Data Studio 360. The report uses Google BigQuery as its data source. You notice that visualizations are not showing data that is less than 1 hour old. What should you do?
false Disable caching by editing the report settings.
false Disable caching in BigQuery by editing table details.
false Refresh your browser tab showing the visualizations.
false Clear your browser history for the past hour then reload the tab showing the virtualizations.
Answer: A
6
Flowlogistic is rolling out their real-time inventory tracking system. The tracking devices will all send package-tracking messages, which will now go to a single Google Cloud Pub/Sub topic instead of the Apache Kafka cluster. A subscriber application will then process the messages for real-time reporting and store them in Google BigQuery for historical analysis. You want to ensure the package data can be analyzed over time. Which approach should you take?
false Attach the timestamp on each message in the Cloud Pub/Sub subscriber application as they are received.
false Attach the timestamp and Package ID on the outbound message from each publisher device as they are sent to Clod Pub/Sub.
false Use the NOW () function in BigQuery to record the event’s time.
false Use the automatically generated timestamp from Cloud Pub/Sub to order the data.
Answer: B
7
Flowlogistic’s management has determined that the current Apache Kafka servers cannot handle the data volume for their real-time inventory tracking system. You need to build a new system on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) that will feed the proprietary tracking software. The system must be able to ingest data from a variety of global sources, process and query in real-time, and store the data reliably. Which combination of GCP products should you choose?
false Cloud Pub/Sub, Cloud Dataflow, and Cloud Storage
false Cloud Pub/Sub, Cloud Dataflow, and Local SSD
false Cloud Pub/Sub, Cloud SQL, and Cloud Storage
false Cloud Load Balancing, Cloud Dataflow, and Cloud Storage
Answer: C
2
MJTelco is building a custom interface to share data. They have these requirements: They need to do aggregations over their petabyte-scale datasets. They need to scan specific time range rows with a very fast response time (milliseconds). Which combination of Google Cloud Platform products should you recommend?
false Cloud Datastore and Cloud Bigtable
false Cloud Bigtable and Cloud SQL
false BigQuery and Cloud Bigtable
false BigQuery and Cloud Storage
Answer: C
6
You create a new report for your large team in Google Data Studio 360. The report uses Google BigQuery as its data source. It is company policy to ensure employees can view only the data associated with their region, so you create and populate a table for each region. You need to enforce the regional access policy to the data. Which two actions should you take? (Choose two.)
false Ensure all the tables are included in global dataset.
false Ensure each table is included in a dataset for a region.
false Adjust the settings for each table to allow a related region-based security group view access.
false Adjust the settings for each view to allow a related region-based security group view access.
false Adjust the settings for each dataset to allow a related region-based security group view access.
Answer: BD
7
Your company produces 20,000 files every hour. Each data file is formatted as a comma separated values (CSV) file that is less than 4 KB. All files must be ingested on Google Cloud Platform before they can be processed. Your company site has a 200 ms latency to Google Cloud, and your Internet connection bandwidth is limited as 50 Mbps. You currently deploy a secure FTP (SFTP) server on a virtual machine in Google Compute Engine as the data ingestion point. A local SFTP client runs on a dedicated machine to transmit the CSV files as is. The goal is to make reports with data from the previous day available to the executives by 10:00 a.m. each day. This design is barely able to keep up with the current volume, even though the bandwidth utilization is rather low. You are told that due to seasonality, your company expects the number of files to double for the next three months. Which two actions should you take? (choose
false Introduce data compression for each file to increase the rate file of file transfer.
false Contact your internet service provider (ISP) to increase your maximum bandwidth to at least 100 Mbps.
false Redesign the data ingestion process to use gsutil tool to send the CSV files to a storage bucket in parallel.
false Assemble 1,000 files into a tape archive (TAR) fil
false Transmit the TAR files instead, and disassemble the CSV files in the cloud upon receiving them.
false Create an S3-compatible storage endpoint in your network, and use Google Cloud Storage Transfer Service to transfer on-premices data to the designated storage bucket.
Answer: CE
0
Your company is loading comma-separated values (CSV) files into Google BigQuery. The data is fully imported successfully; however, the imported data is not matching byte-to-byte to the source file. What is the most likely cause of this problem?
false The CSV data loaded in BigQuery is not flagged as CSV.
false The CSV data has invalid rows that were skipped on import.
false The CSV data loaded in BigQuery is not using BigQuery’s default encoding.
false The CSV data has not gone through an ETL phase before loading into BigQuery.
Answer: B
2
You work for a manufacturing plant that batches application log files together into a single log file once a day at 2:00 AM. You have written a Google Cloud Dataflow job to process that log file. You need to make sure the log file in processed once per day as inexpensively as possible. What should you do?
false Change the processing job to use Google Cloud Dataproc instead.
false Manually start the Cloud Dataflow job each morning when you get into the office.
false Create a cron job with Google App Engine Cron Service to run the Cloud Dataflow job.
false Configure the Cloud Dataflow job as a streaming job so that it processes the log data immediately.
Answer: C
3
All Google Cloud Bigtable client requests go through a front-end server they are sent to a Cloud Bigtable node.
false before
false after
false only if
false once
Answer: A
6
Which of these is NOT a way to customize the software on Dataproc cluster instances?
false Set initialization actions
false Modify configuration files using cluster properties
false Configure the cluster using Cloud Deployment Manager
false Log into the master node and make changes from there
Answer: C
1
Which of these operations can you perform from the BigQuery Web UI?
false Upload a file in SQL format. two.)
false Load data with nested and repeated fields.
false Upload a 20 MB file.
false Upload multiple files using a wildcard.
Answer: B
5
Does Dataflow process batch data pipelines or streaming data pipelines?
false Only Batch Data Pipelines
false Both Batch and Streaming Data Pipelines
false Only Streaming Data Pipelines
false None of the above
Answer: B
7
Which of the following statements about Legacy SQL and Standard SQL is not true?
false Standard SQL is the preferred query language for BigQuery.
false If you write a query in Legacy SQL, it might generate an error if you try to run it with Standard SQL.
false One difference between the two query languages is how you specify fully-qualified table names (i.
false table names that include their associated project name).
false You need to set a query language for each dataset and the default is Standard SQL.
Answer: D
8
What are two methods that can be used to denormalize tables in BigQuery?
false 1) Split table into multiple tables; 2) Use a partitioned table
false 1) Join tables into one table; 2) Use nested repeated fields
false 1) Use a partitioned table; 2) Join tables into one table
false 1) Use nested repeated fields; 2) Use a partitioned table
Answer: B
0
How can you get a neural network to learn about relationships between categories in a categorical feature?
false Create a multi-hot column
false Create a one-hot column
false Create a hash bucket
false Create an embedding column
Answer: D
There are two problems with one-hot encoding. First, it has high dimensionality, meaning that instead of having just one value, like a continuous feature, it has many values, or dimensions. This makes computation more time-consuming, especially if a feature has a very large number of categories. The second problem is that it doesn’t encode any relationships between the categories. They are completely independent from each other, so the network has no way of knowing which ones are similar to each other. Both of these problems can be solved by representing a categorical feature with an embedding column. The idea is that each category has a smaller vector with, let’s say, 5 values in it. But unlike a one-hot vector, the values are not usually 0. The values are weights, similar to the weights that are used for basic features in a neural network. The difference is that each category has a set of weights (5 of them in this case). You can think of each value in the embedding vector as a feature of the category. So, if two categories are very similar to each other, then their embedding vectors should be very similar too. Reference: https://cloudacademy.com/google/introduction-to-google-cloud-machine-learning-engine-course/a-wide-and-dee
5
Which role must be assigned to a service account used by the virtual machines in a Dataproc cluster so they can execute jobs?
false Dataproc Worker
false Dataproc Viewer
false Dataproc Runner
false Dataproc Editor
Answer: A
9
Which of the following statements is NOT true regarding Bigtable access roles?
false Using IAM roles, you cannot give a user access to only one table in a project, rather than all tables in a project.
false To give a user access to only one table in a project, grant the user the Bigtable Editor role for that table.
false You can configure access control only at the project level.
false To give a user access to only one table in a project, you must configure access through your application.
Answer: B
3
Which row keys are likely to cause a disproportionate number of reads and/or writes on a particular node in a Bigtable cluster (select 2 answers)?
false A sequential numeric ID
false A timestamp followed by a stock symbol
false A non-sequential numeric ID
false A stock symbol followed by a timestamp
Answer: AB
5
Which of these statements about BigQuery caching is true?
false By default, a query's results are not cached.
false BigQuery caches query results for 48 hours.
false Query results are cached even if you specify a destination table.
false There is no charge for a query that retrieves its results from cache.
Answer: D
8
Which Java SDK class can you use to run your Dataflow programs locally?
false LocalRunner
false DirectPipelineRunner
false MachineRunner
false LocalPipelineRunner
Answer: B
3
How would you query specific partitions in a BigQuery table?
false Use the DAY column in the WHERE clause
false Use the EXTRACT(DAY) clause
false Use the PARTITIONTIME pseudo-column in the WHERE clause
false Use DATE BETWEEN in the WHERE clause
Answer: C
4
Which is not a valid reason for poor Cloud Bigtable performance?
false The workload isn't appropriate for Cloud Bigtable.
false The table's schema is not designed correctly.
false The Cloud Bigtable cluster has too many nodes.
false There are issues with the network connection.
Answer: C
9
Scaling a Cloud Dataproc cluster typically involves .
false increasing or decreasing the number of worker nodes
false increasing or decreasing the number of master nodes
false moving memory to run more applications on a single node
false deleting applications from unused nodes periodically
Answer: A
4
To give a user read permission for only the first three columns of a table, which access control method would you use?
false Primitive role
false Predefined role
false Authorized view
false It's not possible to give access to only the first three columns of a table.
Answer: C
8
The Dataflow SDKs have been recently transitioned into which Apache service?
false Apache Spark
false Apache Hadoop
false Apache Kafka
false Apache Beam
Answer: D
9
You want to use a BigQuery table as a data sink. In which writing mode(s) can you use BigQuery as a sink?
false Both batch and streaming
false BigQuery cannot be used as a sink
false Only batch
false Only streaming
Answer: A
1
Which of the following are examples of hyperparameters? (Select 2 answers.)
false Number of hidden layers
false Number of nodes in each hidden layer
false Biases
false Weights
Answer: AB
5
Cloud Dataproc charges you only for what you really use with billing.
false month-by-month
false minute-by-minute
false week-by-week
false hour-by-hour
Answer: B
Cloud Dataproc is a managed Apache Hadoop and Apache service.
false Blaze
false Spark
false Fire
false Ignite
Answer: B
01
Which action can a Cloud Dataproc Viewer perform?
false Submit a job.
false Create a cluster.
false Delete a cluster.
false List the jobs.
Answer: D
04
Which of the following statements about the Wide & Deep Learning model are true? (Select 2 answers.)
false The wide model is used for memorization, while the deep model is used for generalization.
false A good use for the wide and deep model is a recommender system.
false The wide model is used for generalization, while the deep model is used for memorization.
false A good use for the wide and deep model is a small-scale linear regression problem.
Answer: AB
09
Which is the preferred method to use to avoid hotspotting in time series data in Bigtable?
false Field promotion
false Randomization
false Salting
false Hashing
Answer: A
12
What are two of the characteristics of using online prediction rather than batch prediction?
false It is optimized to handle a high volume of data instances in a job and to run more complex models.
false Predictions are returned in the response message.
false Predictions are written to output files in a Cloud Storage location that you specify.
false It is optimized to minimize the latency of serving predictions.
Answer: BD
16
You have a data pipeline with a Cloud Dataflow job that aggregates and writes time series metrics to Cloud Bigtable. This data feeds a dashboard used by thousands of users across the organization. You need to support additional concurrent users and reduce the amount of time required to write the data. Which two actions should you take? (Choose two.)
false Configure your Cloud Dataflow pipeline to use local execution
false Increase the maximum number of Cloud Dataflow workers by setting maxNumWorkers in PipelineOptions
false Increase the number of nodes in the Cloud Bigtable cluster
false Modify your Cloud Dataflow pipeline to use the Flatten transform before writing to Cloud Bigtable
false Modify your Cloud Dataflow pipeline to use the CoGroupByKey transform before writing to Cloud Bigtable
Answer: DE
19
You are running a pipeline in Cloud Dataflow that receives messages from a Cloud Pub/Sub topic and writes the results to a BigQuery dataset in the EU. Currently, your pipeline is located in europe-west4 and has a maximum of 3 workers, instance type n1-standard-1. You notice that during peak periods, your pipeline is struggling to process records in a timely fashion, when all 3 workers are at maximum CPU utilization. Which two actions can you take to increase performance of your pipeline? (Choose two.)
false Increase the number of max workers
false Use a larger instance type for your Cloud Dataflow workers
false Change the zone of your Cloud Dataflow pipeline to run in us-central1
false Create a temporary table in Cloud Bigtable that will act as a buffer for new dat
false Create a new step in your pipeline to write to this table first, and then create a new pipeline to write from Cloud Bigtable to BigQuery F. Create a temporary table in Cloud Spanner that will act as a buffer for new dat
false Create a new step in your pipeline to write to this table first, and then create a new pipeline to write from Cloud Spanner to BigQuery
Answer: BE
21
You work on a regression problem in a natural language processing domain, and you have 100M labeled exmaples in your dataset. You have randomly shuffled your data and split your dataset into train and test samples (in a 90/10 ratio). After you trained the neural network and evaluated your model on a test set, you discover that the root-mean-squared error (RMSE) of your model is twice as high on the train set as on the test set. How should you improve the performance of your model?
false Increase the share of the test sample in the train-test split.
false Try to collect more data and increase the size of your dataset.
false Try out regularization techniques (e.g., dropout of batch normalization) to avoid overfitting.
false Increase the complexity of your model by, e.g., introducing an additional layer or increase sizing the size of vocabularies or n-grams used.
Answer: D
25
Your team is responsible for developing and maintaining ETLs in your company. One of your Dataflow jobs is failing because of some errors in the input data, and you need to improve reliability of the pipeline (incl. being able to reprocess all failing data). What should you do?
false Add a filtering step to skip these types of errors in the future, extract erroneous rows from logs.
false Add a try... catch block to your DoFn that transforms the data, extract erroneous rows from logs.
false Add a try... catch block to your DoFn that transforms the data, write erroneous rows to PubSub directly from the DoFn.
false Add a try... catch block to your DoFn that transforms the data, use a sideOutput to create a PCollection that can be stored to PubSub later.
Answer: C
29
A shipping company has live package-tracking data that is sent to an Apache Kafka stream in real time. This is then loaded into BigQuery. Analysts in your company want to query the tracking data in BigQuery to analyze geospatial trends in the lifecycle of a package. The table was originally created with ingest-date partitioning. Over time, the query processing time has increased. You need to implement a change that would improve query performance in BigQuery. What should you do?
false Implement clustering in BigQuery on the ingest date column.
false Implement clustering in BigQuery on the package-tracking ID column.
false Tier older data onto Cloud Storage files, and leverage extended tables.
false Re-create the table using data partitioning on the package delivery date.
Answer: A
34
You have a requirement to insert minute-resolution data from 50,000 sensors into a BigQuery table. You expect significant growth in data volume and need the data to be available within 1 minute of ingestion for real-time analysis of aggregated trends. What should you do?
false Use bq load to load a batch of sensor data every 60 seconds.
false Use a Cloud Dataflow pipeline to stream data into the BigQuery table.
false Use the INSERT statement to insert a batch of data every 60 seconds.
false Use the MERGE statement to apply updates in batch every 60 seconds.
Answer: C
36
You’re training a model to predict housing prices based on an available dataset with real estate properties. Your plan is to train a fully connected neural net, and you’ve discovered that the dataset contains latitude and longtitude of the property. Real estate professionals have told you that the location of the property is highly influential on price, so you’d like to engineer a feature that incorporates this physical dependency. What should you do?
false Provide latitude and longtitude as input vectors to your neural net.
false Create a numeric column from a feature cross of latitude and longtitude.
false Create a feature cross of latitude and longtitude, bucketize at the minute level and use L1 regularization during optimization.
false Create a feature cross of latitude and longtitude, bucketize it at the minute level and use L2 regularization during optimization.
Answer: B
40
You receive data files in CSV format monthly from a third party. You need to cleanse this data, but every third month the schema of the files changes. Your requirements for implementing these transformations include: Executing the transformations on a schedule Enabling non-developer analysts to modify transformations Providing a graphical tool for designing transformations What should you do?
false Use Cloud Dataprep to build and maintain the transformation recipes, and execute them on a scheduled basis
false Load each month’s CSV data into BigQuery, and write a SQL query to transform the data to a standard schem
false Merge the transformed tables together with a SQL query
false Help the analysts write a Cloud Dataflow pipeline in Python to perform the transformatio
false The Python code should be stored in a revision control system and modified as the incoming data’s schema changes
false Use Apache Spark on Cloud Dataproc to infer the schema of the CSV file before creating a Dataframe.Then implement the transformations in Spark SQL before writing the data out to Cloud Storage and loading into BigQuery
Answer: D
43
Your analytics team wants to build a simple statistical model to determine which customers are most likely to work with your company again, based on a few different metrics. They want to run the model on Apache Spark, using data housed in Google Cloud Storage, and you have recommended using Google Cloud Dataproc to execute this job. Testing has shown that this workload can run in approximately 30 minutes on a 15-node cluster, outputting the results into Google BigQuery. The plan is to run this workload weekly. How should you optimize the cluster for cost?
false Migrate the workload to Google Cloud Dataflow
false Use pre-emptible virtual machines (VMs) for the cluster
false Use a higher-memory node so that the job runs faster
false Use SSDs on the worker nodes so that the job can run faster
Answer: A
47
You are designing storage for two relational tables that are part of a 10-TB database on Google Cloud. You want to support transactions that scale horizontally. You also want to optimize data for range queries on nonkey columns. What should you do?
false Use Cloud SQL for storag
false Add secondary indexes to support query patterns.
false Use Cloud SQL for storag
false Use Cloud Dataflow to transform data to support query patterns. E. Use Cloud Spanner for storag
false Add secondary indexes to support query patterns.
false Use Cloud Spanner for storag
false Use Cloud Dataflow to transform data to support query patterns.
Answer: D
49
You are a retailer that wants to integrate your online sales capabilities with different in-home assistants, such as Google Home. You need to interpret customer voice commands and issue an order to the backend systems. Which solutions should you choose?
false Cloud Speech-to-Text API
false Cloud Natural Language API
false Dialogflow Enterprise Edition
false Cloud AutoML Natural Language
Answer: D
51
Your financial services company is moving to cloud technology and wants to store 50 TB of financial timeseries data in the cloud. This data is updated frequently and new data will be streaming in all the time. Your company also wants to move their existing Apache Hadoop jobs to the cloud to get insights into this data. Which product should they use to store the data?
false Cloud Bigtable
false Google BigQuery
false Google Cloud Storage
false Google Cloud Datastore
Answer: A
54
You are developing an application on Google Cloud that will automatically generate subject labels for users’ blog posts. You are under competitive pressure to add this feature quickly, and you have no additional developer resources. No one on your team has experience with machine learning. What should you do?
false Call the Cloud Natural Language API from your applicatio
false Process the generated Entity Analysis as labels.
false Call the Cloud Natural Language API from your applicatio
false Process the generated Sentiment Analysis as labels.
false Build and train a text classification model using TensorFlo
false Deploy the model using Cloud Machine Learning Engin
false Call the model from your application and process the results as labels. H. Build and train a text classification model using TensorFlo
false Deploy the model using a KubernetesEngine cluste
false Call the model from your application and process the results as labels.
Answer: B
55
You need to move 2 PB of historical data from an on-premises storage appliance to Cloud Storage within six months, and your outbound network capacity is constrained to 20 Mb/sec. How should you migrate this data to Cloud Storage?
false Use Transfer Appliance to copy the data to Cloud Storage
false Use gsutil cp –J to compress the content being uploaded to Cloud Storage
false Create a private URL for the historical data, and then use Storage Transfer Service to copy the data to Cloud Storage
false Use trickle or ionice along with gsutil cp to limit the amount of bandwidth gsutil utilizes to less than 20 Mb/sec so it does not interfere with the production traffic
Answer: A
58
You want to automate execution of a multi-step data pipeline running on Google Cloud. The pipeline includes Cloud Dataproc and Cloud Dataflow jobs that have multiple dependencies on each other. You want to use managed services where possible, and the pipeline will run every day. Which tool should you use?
false cron
false Cloud Composer
false Cloud Scheduler
false Workflow Templates on Cloud Dataproc
Answer: D
61
You are integrating one of your internal IT applications and Google BigQuery, so users can query BigQuery from the application’s interface. You do not want individual users to authenticate to BigQuery and you do not want to give them access to the dataset. You need to securely access BigQuery from your IT application. What should you do?
false Create groups for your users and give those groups access to the dataset
false Integrate with a single sign-on (SSO) platform, and pass each user’s credentials along with the query request
false Create a service account and grant dataset access to that accoun
false Use the service account’s private key to access the dataset
false Create a dummy user and grant dataset access to that use
false Store the username and password for that user in a file on the files system, and use those credentials to access the BigQuery dataset
Answer: C
66
Your globally distributed auction application allows users to bid on items. Occasionally, users place identical bids at nearly identical times, and different application servers process those bids. Each bid event contains the item, amount, user, and timestamp. You want to collate those bid events into a single location in real time to determine which user bid first. What should you do?
false Create a file on a shared file and have the application servers write all bid events to that fil
false Process the file with Apache Hadoop to identify which user bid first.
false Have each application server write the bid events to Cloud Pub/Sub as they occu
false Push the events from Cloud Pub/Sub to a custom endpoint that writes the bid event information into Cloud SQL. E. Set up a MySQL database for each application server to write bid events int
false Periodically query each of those distributed MySQL databases and update a master MySQL database with bid event information. G. Have each application server write the bid events to Google Cloud Pub/Sub as they occu
false Use a pull subscription to pull the bid events using Google Cloud Dataflo
false Give the bid for each item to the userIn the bid event that is processed first.
Answer: C
68
Each analytics team in your organization is running BigQuery jobs in their own projects. You want to enable each team to monitor slot usage within their projects. What should you do?
false Create a Stackdriver Monitoring dashboard based on the BigQuery metric query/scanned_bytes
false Create a Stackdriver Monitoring dashboard based on the BigQuery metric slots/allocated_for_project
false Create a log export for each project, capture the BigQuery job execution logs, create a custom metric based on the totalSlotMs, and create a Stackdriver Monitoring dashboard based on the custom metric
false Create an aggregated log export at the organization level, capture the BigQuery job execution logs, create a custom metric based on the totalSlotMs, and create a Stackdriver Monitoring dashboard based on the custom metric
Answer: D
71
You have a data pipeline that writes data to Cloud Bigtable using well-designed row keys. You want to monitor your pipeline to determine when to increase the size of you Cloud Bigtable cluster. Which two actions can you take to accomplish this? Choose 2 answers.
false Review Key Visualizer metric
false Increase the size of the Cloud Bigtable cluster when the Read pressure index is above 100.
false Review Key Visualizer metric
false Increase the size of the Cloud Bigtable cluster when the Write pressure index is above 100.
false Monitor the latency of write operation
false Increase the size of the Cloud Bigtable cluster when there is a sustained increase in write latency.
false Monitor storage utilizatio
false Increase the size of the Cloud Bigtable cluster when utilization increases above 70% of max capacity. I. Monitor latency of read operation
false Increase the size of the Cloud Bigtable cluster of read operations take longer than 100 ms.
Answer: AC
72
You work for a manufacturing company that sources up to 750 different components, each from a different supplier. You’ve collected a labeled dataset that has on average 1000 examples for each unique component. Your team wants to implement an app to help warehouse workers recognize incoming components based on a photo of the component. You want to implement the first working version of this app (as Proof-Of-Concept) within a few working days. What should you do?
false Use Cloud Vision AutoML with the existing dataset.
false Use Cloud Vision AutoML, but reduce your dataset twice.
false Use Cloud Vision API by providing custom labels as recognition hints.
false Train your own image recognition model leveraging transfer learning techniques.
Answer: A
73
You are operating a Cloud Dataflow streaming pipeline. The pipeline aggregates events from a Cloud Pub/Sub subscription source, within a window, and sinks the
resulting aggregation to a Cloud Storage bucket. The source has consistent throughput. You want to monitor an alert on behavior of the pipeline with Cloud Stackdriver to ensure that it is processing data. Which Stackdriver alerts should you create?
false An alert based on a decrease of subscription/num_undelivered_messages for the source and a rate of change increase of instance/storage/used_bytes for the destination
false An alert based on an increase of subscription/num_undelivered_messages for the source and a rate of change decrease of instance/storage/used_bytes for the destination
false An alert based on a decrease of instance/storage/used_bytes for the source and a rate of change increase of subscription/num_undelivered_messages for the destination
false An alert based on an increase of instance/storage/used_bytes for the source and a rate of change decrease of subscription/num_undelivered_messages for the destination
Answer: B
76
Government regulations in your industry mandate that you have to maintain an auditable record of access to certain types of datA. Assuming that all expiring logs will be archived correctly, where should you store data that is subject to that mandate?
false Encrypted on Cloud Storage with user-supplied encryption key
false A separate decryption key will be given to each authorized user.
false In a BigQuery dataset that is viewable only by authorized personnel, with the Data Access log used to provide the auditability.
false In Cloud SQL, with separate database user names to each use
false The Cloud SQL Admin activity logs will be used to provide the auditability.
false In a bucket on Cloud Storage that is accessible only by an AppEngine service that collects user information and logs the access before providing a link to the bucket.
Answer: B
77
You need to set access to BigQuery for different departments within your company. Your solution should comply with the following requirements: Each department should have access only to their data. Each department will have one or more leads who need to be able to create and update tables and provide them to their team. Each department has data analysts who need to be able to query but not modify data. How should you set access to the data in BigQuery?
false Create a dataset for each departmen
false Assign the department leads the role of OWNER, and assign the data analysts the role of WRITER on their dataset.
false Create a dataset for each departmen
false Assign the department leads the role of WRITER, and assign the data analysts the role of READER on their dataset.
false Create a table for each departmen
false Assign the department leads the role of Owner, and assign the data analysts the role of Editor on the project the table is in. G. Create a table for each departmen
false Assign the department leads the role of Editor, and assign the data analysts the role of Viewer on the project the table is in.
Answer: D
82
You have a query that filters a BigQuery table using a WHERE clause on timestamp and ID columns. By using bq query – -dry_run you learn that the query triggers a full scan of the table, even though the filter on timestamp and ID select a tiny fraction of the overall data. You want to reduce the amount of data scanned by BigQuery with minimal changes to existing SQL queries. What should you do?
false Create a separate table for each ID.
false Use the LIMIT keyword to reduce the number of rows returned.
false Recreate the table with a partitioning column and clustering column.
false Use the bq query - -maximum_bytes_billed flag to restrict the number of bytes billed.
Answer: B
83
Data Analysts in your company have the Cloud IAM Owner role assigned to them in their projects to allow them to work with multiple GCP products in their projects. Your organization requires that all BigQuery data access logs be retained for 6 months. You need to ensure that only audit personnel in your company can access the data access logs for all projects. What should you do?
false Enable data access logs in each Data Analyst’s projec
false Restrict access to Stackdriver Logging via Cloud IAM roles.
false Export the data access logs via a project-level export sink to a Cloud Storage bucket in the Data Analysts’ project
false Restrict access to the Cloud Storage bucket.
false Export the data access logs via a project-level export sink to a Cloud Storage bucket in a newly created projects for audit log F. Restrict access to the project with the exported logs.
false Export the data access logs via an aggregated export sink to a Cloud Storage bucket in a newly created project for audit log H. Restrict access to the project that contains the exported logs.
Answer: D
You need to migrate a 2TB relational database to Google Cloud Platform. You do not have the resources to significantly refactor the application that uses this database and cost to operate is of primary concern. Which service do you select for storing and serving your data?
false Cloud Spanner
false Cloud Bigtable
false Cloud Firestore
false Cloud SQL
Answer: D
88
You use BigQuery as your centralized analytics platform. New data is loaded every day, and an ETL pipeline modifies the original data and prepares it for the final users. This ETL pipeline is regularly modified and can generate errors, but sometimes the errors are detected only after 2 weeks. You need to provide a method to recover from these errors, and your backups should be optimized for storage costs. How should you organize your data in BigQuery and store your backups?
false Organize your data in a single table, export, and compress and store the BigQuery data in Cloud Storage.
false Organize your data in separate tables for each month, and export, compress, and store the data in Cloud Storage.
false Organize your data in separate tables for each month, and duplicate your data on a separate dataset in BigQuery.
false Organize your data in separate tables for each month, and use snapshot decorators to restore the table to a time prior to the corruption.
Answer: D

You are planning to migrate your current on-premises Apache Hadoop deployment to the cloud. You need to ensure that the deployment is as fault-tolerant and cost-effective as possible for long-running batch jobs. You want to use a managed service. What should you do?
false Deploy a Cloud Dataproc cluste
false Use a standard persistent disk and 50% preemptible worker
false Store data in Cloud Storage, and change references in scripts from hdfs:// to gs://
false Deploy a Cloud Dataproc cluste
false Use an SSD persistent disk and 50% preemptible worker
false Store data in Cloud Storage, and change references in scripts from hdfs:// to gs://
false Install Hadoop and Spark on a 10-node Compute Engine instance group with standard instance
false Install the Cloud Storage connector, and store the data in Cloud Storag
false Change references in scripts from hdfs:// to gs://
false Install Hadoop and Spark on a 10-node Compute Engine instance group with preemptible instances.Store data in HDF K. Change references in scripts from hdfs:// to gs://

You have several Spark jobs that run on a Cloud Dataproc cluster on a schedule. Some of the jobs run in sequence, and some of the jobs run concurrently. You need to automate this process. What should you do?
false Create a Cloud Dataproc Workflow Template
false Create an initialization action to execute the jobs
false Create a Directed Acyclic Graph in Cloud Composer
false Create a Bash script that uses the Cloud SDK to create a cluster, execute jobs, and then tear down the cluster
Answer: A
98
You’re using Bigtable for a real-time application, and you have a heavy load that is a mix of read and writes. You’ve recently identified an additional use case and need to perform hourly an analytical job to calculate certain statistics across the whole database. You need to ensure both the reliability of your production application as well as the analytical workload. What should you do?
false Export Bigtable dump to GCS and run your analytical job on top of the exported files.
false Add a second cluster to an existing instance with a multi-cluster routing, use live-traffic app profile for your regular workload and batch-analytics profile for the analytics workload.
false Add a second cluster to an existing instance with a single-cluster routing, use live-traffic app profile for your regular workload and batch-analytics profile for the analytics workload.
false Increase the size of your existing cluster twice and execute your analytics workload on your new resized cluster.
Answer: B

You have a data stored in BigQuery. The data in the BigQuery dataset must be highly available. You need to define a storage, backup, and recovery strategy of this data that minimizes cost. How should you configure the BigQuery table?
85
false Set the BigQuery dataset to be regiona
false In the event of an emergency, use a point-in-time snapshot to recover the data.
false Set the BigQuery dataset to be regiona
false Create a scheduled query to make copies of the data to tables suffixed with the time of the backu E. In the event of an emergency, use the backup copy of the table.
false Set the BigQuery dataset to be multi-regiona
false In the event of an emergency, use a point-in-time snapshot to recover the data.
false Set the BigQuery dataset to be multi-regiona
false Create a scheduled query to make copies of the data to tables suffixed with the time of the backu J. In the event of an emergency, use the backup copy of the table.

You want to migrate an on-premises Hadoop system to Cloud Dataproc. Hive is the primary tool in use, and the data format is Optimized Row Columnar (ORC). All ORC files have been successfully copied to a Cloud Storage bucket. You need to replicate some data to the cluster’s local Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) to maximize performance. What are two ways to start using Hive in Cloud Dataproc? (Choose two.)
false Run the gsutil utility to transfer all ORC files from the Cloud Storage bucket to HDF
false Mount the Hive tables locally.
false Run the gsutil utility to transfer all ORC files from the Cloud Storage bucket to any node of the Dataproc cluste
false Mount the Hive tables locally.

false Mount the Hive tables from HDFS.
false Leverage Cloud Storage connector for Hadoop to mount the ORC files as external Hive table
false Replicate external Hive tables to the native ones.
false Load the ORC files into BigQuer
false Leverage BigQuery connector for Hadoop to mount the BigQuery tables as external Hive table L. Replicate external Hive tables to the native ones.

You want to collect metrics including network connections, disk IO and replication status from MariaDB with minimal development effort and use StackDriver for dashboards and alerts. false Install the OpenCensus Agent and create a custom metric collection application with a StackDriver exporter.
false Place the MariaDB instances in an Instance Group with a Health Check.
false Install the StackDriver Logging Agent and configure fluentd in_tail plugin to read MariaDB logs.
false Install the StackDriver Agent and configure the MySQL plugin.

You are working on a niche product in the image recognition domain. Your team has developed a model that is dominated by custom C++ TensorFlow ops your team has implemented. These ops are used inside your main training loop and are performing bulky matrix multiplications. It currently takes up to several days to train a model. You want to decrease this time significantly and keep the cost low by using an accelerator on Google Cloud. What should you do?
false Use Cloud TPUs without any additional adjustment to your code.
false Use Cloud TPUs after implementing GPU kernel support for your customs ops.
false Use Cloud GPUs after implementing GPU kernel support for your customs ops.
false Stay on CPUs, and increase the size of the cluster you’re training your model on.

false Store and process the entire dataset in BigQuery.
false Store and process the entire dataset in Cloud Bigtable.
false Store the full dataset in BigQuery, and store a compressed copy of the data in a Cloud Storage bucket.
false Store the warm data as files in Cloud Storage, and store the active data in BigQuer
false Keep this ratio as 80% warm and 20% active.

false Use Cloud Dataflow with Beam to detect errors and perform transformations.
false Use Cloud Dataprep with recipes to detect errors and perform transformations.
false Use Cloud Dataproc with a Hadoop job to detect errors and perform transformations.
false Use federated tables in BigQuery with queries to detect errors and perform transformations.

The marketing team at your organization provides regular updates of a segment of your customer dataset. The marketing team has given you a CSV with 1 million records that must be updated in BigQuery. When you use the UPDATE statement in BigQuery, you receive a quotaExceeded error. What should you do?
false Reduce the number of records updated each day to stay within the BigQuery UPDATE DML statement limit.
false Increase the BigQuery UPDATE DML statement limit in the Quota management section of the Google Cloud Platform Console.
false Split the source CSV file into smaller CSV files in Cloud Storage to reduce the number of BigQuery UPDATE DML statements per BigQuery job.
false Import the new records from the CSV file into a new BigQuery tabl
false Create a BigQuery job that merges the new records with the existing records and writes the results to a new BigQuery table.

false Use Cloud ML Engine for training existing Spark ML models
false Rewrite your models on TensorFlow, and start using Cloud ML Engine
false Use Cloud Dataproc for training existing Spark ML models, but start reading data directly from BigQuery

false Use gcloud kms keys create to create a symmetric ke
false Then use gcloud kms encrypt to encrypt each archival file with the key and unique additional authenticated data (AAD). Use gsutil cp to upload each encrypted file to the Cloud Storage bucket, and keep the AAD outside of Google Cloud.
false Use gcloud kms keys create to create a symmetric ke
false Then use gcloud kms encrypt to encrypt each archival file with the ke
false Use gsutil cp to upload each encrypted file to the Cloud Storage bucke
false Manually destroy the key previously used for encryption, and rotate the key once and rotate the key once.
false Specify customer-supplied encryption key (CSEK) in the .boto configuration fil
false Use gsutil cp to upload each archival file to the Cloud Storage bucke
false Save the CSEK in Cloud Memorystore as permanent storage of the secret.
false Specify customer-supplied encryption key (CSEK) in the .boto configuration fil
false Use gsutil cp to upload each archival file to the Cloud Storage bucke L. Save the CSEK in a different project that only the security team can access.

false Use Cloud Dataprep to find null values in sample source dat
false Convert all nulls to ‘none’ using a Cloud Dataproc job.

false Use Cloud Dataflow to find null values in sample source dat H. Convert all nulls to using a custom script.
